summary: Surell Brady was a Staff Counsel for the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). Payroll records and certifications from 1977 and 1978 consistently list Brady as an employee of the HSCA, detailing their position and salary. A Final Determination Notification from the Assassination Records Review Board mentions Brady in the context of HSCA staff payroll records, specifically regarding payroll authorization forms. While the documents provide insight into Brady's employment with the HSCA, they do not offer specific details regarding their direct involvement in the investigation of the JFK assassination beyond their role as Staff Counsel.
significance: Surell Brady's significance lies in their role as Staff Counsel for the HSCA, indicating their involvement in the investigation of the JFK assassination. The documents primarily highlight their employment and salary details within the committee.
